file.content:
-- User configurable settings
property speechRate : 220 -- Words per minute (default: 220)
property pauseDuration : 0.0 -- Pause between lines in seconds (default: 0.0)
property isRunning : false

-- Strip markdown formatting
on stripMarkdown(theText)
    -- Remove bold/italic markers
    set theText to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of theText & " | sed 's/\\*\\*//g' | sed 's/\\*//g'"
    -- Remove headers
    set theText to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of theText & " | sed 's/^#\\+\\s*//g'"
    -- Remove bullet points
    set theText to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of theText & " | sed 's/^-\\s*//g'"
    return theText
end stripMarkdown

-- Kill all existing speech processes before starting
on killExistingSpeech()
    try
        set isRunning to false
        do shell script "pkill -KILL -f 'say -r' 2>/dev/null || true"
        do shell script "pkill -KILL -f 'sh -c.*say' 2>/dev/null || true"
        do shell script "pkill -KILL 'afplay' 2>/dev/null || true"
        do shell script "rm -f /tmp/tts_*.txt 2>/dev/null || true"
        delay 0.2
    end try
end killExistingSpeech

try
    my killExistingSpeech()
    set isRunning to true
    
    set clipboardContent to (the clipboard as text)
    
    if clipboardContent is not "" then
        -- Split content into paragraphs and process each with a pause
        set paragraphList to paragraphs of clipboardContent
        log "INITIAL CLIPBOARD LENGTH: " & (length of clipboardContent) & " characters"
        repeat with i from 1 to count of paragraphList
            if not isRunning then exit repeat
            
            set currentParagraph to item i of paragraphList
            if currentParagraph is not "" then
                -- Strip markdown and create temporary file
                set cleanedParagraph to my stripMarkdown(currentParagraph)
                set tmpFile to "/tmp/tts_paragraph_" & i & ".txt"
                do shell script "echo " & quoted form of cleanedParagraph & " > " & quoted form of tmpFile
                
                if currentParagraph is "" then
                    log "WARNING: EMPTY PARAGRAPH AT INDEX " & i
                end if
                
                try
                    -- Read the current paragraph
                    set cmd to "cat " & quoted form of tmpFile & " | say -r " & speechRate & " >/dev/null 2>&1 || exit 0"
                    do shell script cmd
                    
                    -- Clean up current paragraph's temp file
                    do shell script "rm -f " & quoted form of tmpFile & " 2>/dev/null || true"
                    
                    -- Add pause between paragraphs if not the last one
                    if i < (count of paragraphList) then
                        delay pauseDuration
                    end if
                on error errMsg number errNum
                    if errMsg is not "The command terminated due to receipt of a signal." and errNum is not in {1, -1700} then
                        display dialog "Error speaking text: " & errMsg buttons {"OK"} default button "OK"
                        log "TTS ERROR AT PARAGRAPH " & i & ": " & errMsg
                    end if
                    exit repeat
                end try
            end if
        end repeat
        
        -- Final cleanup
        do shell script "rm -f /tmp/tts_paragraph_*.txt 2>/dev/null || true"
    else
        display dialog "Clipboard is empty or does not contain text." buttons {"OK"} default button "OK"
    end if
on error errMsg number errNum
    if errNum is -1700 then
        display dialog "Clipboard content is not text." buttons {"OK"} default button "OK"
    else if errNum is not 1 then
        display dialog errMsg buttons {"OK"} default button "OK"
    end if
end try

message.content: I wish to make this more interesting but by having more count the total character in the response. Say for example, if such a short response like "tell me a joke, the total number of of characters too little, then I would rather speak the entire thing, because if the entire thing at our current rate of speech can be finished in 10 seconds or less, I would rather have the entire response read out to me aloud instead of by parsing only the last paragraph. So it's up to the entire response. see if the entire response is longer than a certain amount of time to be finished, according to our tax speech rate.

content.text:
I understand! You want to enhance the TTS functionality to be smarter about content length. Instead of just reading the last paragraph, you want it to:

1. Calculate the total speech duration of the entire response
2. If the entire response would take ≤10 seconds to read, read the whole thing
3. If it's longer, use the current paragraph-based logic
4. When using paragraph logic, if a paragraph is too short, keep adding preceding paragraphs until you reach an optimal length

1→#!/bin/bash
     2→
     3→# Enhanced TTS script - Speaks the last paragraph of Claude responses
     4→# Rotate log if it gets too large (>50KB)
     5→if [[ -f /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log ]] && [[ $(stat -f%z /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log 2>/dev/null || echo 0) -gt 51200 ]]; then
     6→    mv /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log.old
     7→fi
     8→echo "$(date): Enhanced TTS hook triggered" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
     9→
    10→# Read JSON input from stdin
    11→input=$(cat)
    12→echo "Input received: $input" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    13→
    14→# Extract session_id and transcript_path from JSON input
    15→session_id=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session_id // empty')
    16→transcript_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.transcript_path // empty')
    17→echo "Session ID: $session_id" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    18→echo "Transcript path: $transcript_path" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    19→
    20→if [[ -n "$transcript_path" && -f "$transcript_path" ]]; then
    21→    echo "File exists and is readable" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    22→    
    23→    # Wait for transcript to be fully written by polling for a complete entry
    24→    # We'll wait up to 5 seconds, checking every 0.5 seconds
    25→    max_attempts=10
    26→    attempt=0
    27→    last_response=""
    28→    
    29→    while [[ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]]; do
    30→        # Get the last few lines and look for the most recent assistant response
    31→        last_lines=$(tail -20 "$transcript_path" 2>/dev/null)
    32→        
    33→        # Look for assistant response with our session ID
    34→        temp_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
    35→            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
    36→                # Check if this is an assistant message with matching session
    37→                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
    38→                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
    39→                line_session=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.sessionId // empty' 2>/dev/null)
    40→                
    41→                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" && "$line_session" == "$session_id" ]]; then
    42→                    # Try to extract text content
    43→                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
    44→                    
    45→                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 20 ]]; then
    46→                        echo "$text_content"
    47→                        exit 0
    48→                    fi
    49→                fi
    50→            fi
    51→        done 2>/dev/null)
    52→        
    53→        if [[ -n "$temp_response" && ${#temp_response} -gt 20 ]]; then
    54→            last_response="$temp_response"
    55→            echo "Found complete response on attempt $((attempt + 1)): ${#last_response} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    56→            break
    57→        fi
    58→        
    59→        echo "Attempt $((attempt + 1)): Waiting for complete transcript entry..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    60→        sleep 0.5
    61→        ((attempt++))
    62→    done
    63→    
    64→    if [[ -z "$last_response" ]]; then
    65→        echo "Timeout: Falling back to any available response" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    66→        # Fallback: try to get any recent assistant response

file.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Enhanced TTS script - Speaks the last paragraph of Claude responses
# Rotate log if it gets too large (>50KB)
if [[ -f /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log ]] && [[ $(stat -f%z /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log 2>/dev/null || echo 0) -gt 51200 ]]; then
    mv /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log.old
fi
echo "$(date): Enhanced TTS hook triggered" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Read JSON input from stdin
input=$(cat)
echo "Input received: $input" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Extract session_id and transcript_path from JSON input
session_id=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session_id // empty')
transcript_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.transcript_path // empty')
echo "Session ID: $session_id" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Transcript path: $transcript_path" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

if [[ -n "$transcript_path" && -f "$transcript_path" ]]; then
    echo "File exists and is readable" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    # Wait for transcript to be fully written by polling for a complete entry
    # We'll wait up to 5 seconds, checking every 0.5 seconds
    max_attempts=10
    attempt=0
    last_response=""
    
    while [[ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]]; do
        # Get the last few lines and look for the most recent assistant response
        last_lines=$(tail -20 "$transcript_path" 2>/dev/null)
        
        # Look for assistant response with our session ID
        temp_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                # Check if this is an assistant message with matching session
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                line_session=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.sessionId // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" && "$line_session" == "$session_id" ]]; then
                    # Try to extract text content
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 20 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
        
        if [[ -n "$temp_response" && ${#temp_response} -gt 20 ]]; then
            last_response="$temp_response"
            echo "Found complete response on attempt $((attempt + 1)): ${#last_response} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            break
        fi
        
        echo "Attempt $((attempt + 1)): Waiting for complete transcript entry..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        sleep 0.5
        ((attempt++))
    done
    
    if [[ -z "$last_response" ]]; then
        echo "Timeout: Falling back to any available response" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        # Fallback: try to get any recent assistant response
        last_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" ]]; then
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 10 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
    fi
    
    echo "Final extracted response length: ${#last_response}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    echo "First 150 chars: ${last_response:0:150}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    if [[ -n "$last_response" && ${#last_response} -gt 10 ]]; then
        # Clean up markdown
        clean_text=$(echo "$last_response" | \
            sed 's/\\n/ /g' | \
            sed 's/\*\*\([^*]*\)\*\*/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/`\([^`]*\)`/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/<[^>]*>//g')
        
        echo "Cleaned text length: ${#clean_text}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Calculate estimated speech time at 220 WPM
        # Average 5 characters per word, 220 WPM = 1100 characters per minute = 18.33 chars/second
        estimated_seconds=$(echo "${#clean_text} / 18.33" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
        echo "Estimated speech time: ${estimated_seconds} seconds for ${#clean_text} characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # If response is short enough (≤10 seconds), read the entire thing
        if (( $(echo "$estimated_seconds <= 10" | bc -l) )); then
            final_sentence="$clean_text"
            echo "Reading entire response (${estimated_seconds}s ≤ 10s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            # For longer responses, get the last paragraph
            echo "Response too long (${estimated_seconds}s > 10s), reading last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            
            # Get the LAST PARAGRAPH by splitting on double newlines and taking the final one
            last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n\\n/\n\n/g' | awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} END{print}' | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//' | sed 's/[[:space:]]*$//')
            
            # If the last paragraph is too short or empty, try splitting on single newlines
            if [[ -z "$last_paragraph" || ${#last_paragraph} -lt 20 ]]; then
                last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g' | awk 'END{print}' | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
            fi
            
            # If still too short, fall back to last 150 characters
            if [[ -z "$last_paragraph" || ${#last_paragraph} -lt 15 ]]; then
                last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
            fi
            
            final_sentence="$last_paragraph"
        fi
        
        echo "Final text for TTS (${#final_sentence} chars): ${final_sentence:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Speak the final sentence at a slower rate
        if [[ -n "$final_sentence" && ${#final_sentence} -gt 3 ]]; then
            # Use -r flag to set speech rate (words per minute)
            # User prefers 220 WPM for optimal speech
            nohup say -r 220 "$final_sentence" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "TTS executed successfully at 220 WPM" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "Fallback TTS executed - final sentence too short" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
    else
        # Fallback message
        nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
        echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    fi
else
    # Fallback if no transcript available
    nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
fi

input.plan:
## Enhancement Plan for Claude Code TTS Hooks

### Current State Analysis:
- You have Claude Code configured with Stop hooks that trigger TTS
- Current script (`claude_response_speaker.sh`) already has smart logic:
  - Calculates speech duration (220 WPM = 18.33 chars/second)
  - If ≤10 seconds, reads entire response
  - If >10 seconds, reads only last paragraph
  - Has fallbacks for short paragraphs

### Proposed Enhancements:

1. **Intelligent Paragraph Aggregation Logic:**
   - When last paragraph is too short (< minimum threshold), collect preceding paragraphs
   - Keep adding previous paragraphs until we reach optimal length
   - Stop adding if next addition would exceed maximum threshold

2. **Configurable Parameters:**
   - Minimum character threshold (current: ~20 chars)
   - Maximum duration threshold (current: 10 seconds)  
   - Target optimal length range (e.g., 3-8 seconds of speech)

3. **Enhanced Length Calculation:**
   - More precise WPM calculations based on actual content
   - Consider punctuation and pauses in timing estimates

4. **Improved Paragraph Detection:**
   - Better parsing of markdown structure
   - Handle various paragraph separators
   - Preserve sentence boundaries when aggregating

5. **Implementation Strategy:**
   - Modify the existing `claude_response_speaker.sh` script
   - Add backward paragraph collection logic after line 110
   - Maintain existing 10-second whole-response logic
   - Add configuration variables at top of script

The enhancement will make the TTS more intelligent about content length while preserving your existing workflow and preferences.

# Enhanced TTS script - Intelligently speaks Claude responses with paragraph aggregation
# Configurable TTS parameters
SPEECH_RATE=220                    # Words per minute
CHARS_PER_SECOND=18.33            # Estimated characters per second (220 WPM / 60 * 5 chars/word)
MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS=10      # If entire response ≤ this, read it all

TARGET_MAX_SECONDS=8              # Target maximum speech duration before stopping aggregation
TARGET_MIN_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MIN_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')

                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" ]]; then
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 10 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
    fi
    
    echo "Final extracted response length: ${#last_response}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    echo "First 150 chars: ${last_response:0:150}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    if [[ -n "$last_response" && ${#last_response} -gt 10 ]]; then
        # Clean up markdown
        clean_text=$(echo "$last_response" | \
            sed 's/\\n/ /g' | \
            sed 's/\*\*\([^*]*\)\*\*/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/`\([^`]*\)`/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/<[^>]*>//g')
        
        echo "Cleaned text length: ${#clean_text}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Calculate estimated speech time at 220 WPM
        # Average 5 characters per word, 220 WPM = 1100 characters per minute = 18.33 chars/second
        estimated_seconds=$(echo "${#clean_text} / 18.33" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
        echo "Estimated speech time: ${estimated_seconds} seconds for ${#clean_text} characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # If response is short enough (≤10 seconds), read the entire thing
        if (( $(echo "$estimated_seconds <= 10" | bc -l) )); then
            final_sentence="$clean_text"
            echo "Reading entire response (${estimated_seconds}s ≤ 10s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            # For longer responses, get the last paragraph
            echo "Response too long (${estimated_seconds}s > 10s), reading last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            
            # Get the LAST PARAGRAPH by splitting on double newlines and taking the final one
            last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n\\n/\n\n/g' | awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} END{print}' | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//' | sed 's/[[:space:]]*$//')
            
            # If the last paragraph is too short or empty, try splitting on single newlines
            if [[ -z "$last_paragraph" || ${#last_paragraph} -lt 20 ]]; then
                last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g' | awk 'END{print}' | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
            fi
            
            # If still too short, fall back to last 150 characters
            if [[ -z "$last_paragraph" || ${#last_paragraph} -lt 15 ]]; then
                last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
            fi
            
            final_sentence="$last_paragraph"
        fi
        
        echo "Final text for TTS (${#final_sentence} chars): ${final_sentence:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Speak the final sentence at a slower rate
        if [[ -n "$final_sentence" && ${#final_sentence} -gt 3 ]]; then
            # Use -r flag to set speech rate (words per minute)
            # User prefers 220 WPM for optimal speech
            nohup say -r 220 "$final_sentence" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "TTS executed successfully at 220 WPM" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "Fallback TTS executed - final sentence too short" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
    else
        # Fallback message
        nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
        echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    fi
else
    # Fallback if no transcript available
    nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
fi

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash

# Enhanced TTS script - Intelligently speaks Claude responses with paragraph aggregation
# Configurable TTS parameters
SPEECH_RATE=220                    # Words per minute
CHARS_PER_SECOND=18.33            # Estimated characters per second (220 WPM / 60 * 5 chars/word)
MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS=10      # If entire response ≤ this, read it all
MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS=50            # Minimum characters for a paragraph to be considered adequate
TARGET_MIN_SECONDS=3              # Target minimum speech duration 
TARGET_MAX_SECONDS=8              # Target maximum speech duration before stopping aggregation
TARGET_MIN_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MIN_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
TARGET_MAX_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MAX_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
# Rotate log if it gets too large (>50KB)
if [[ -f /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log ]] && [[ $(stat -f%z /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log 2>/dev/null || echo 0) -gt 51200 ]]; then
    mv /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log.old
fi
echo "$(date): Enhanced TTS hook triggered" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Read JSON input from stdin
input=$(cat)
echo "Input received: $input" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Extract session_id and transcript_path from JSON input
session_id=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session_id // empty')
transcript_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.transcript_path // empty')
echo "Session ID: $session_id" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Transcript path: $transcript_path" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

if [[ -n "$transcript_path" && -f "$transcript_path" ]]; then
    echo "File exists and is readable" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    # Wait for transcript to be fully written by polling for a complete entry
    # We'll wait up to 5 seconds, checking every 0.5 seconds
    max_attempts=10
    attempt=0
    last_response=""
    
    while [[ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]]; do
        # Get the last few lines and look for the most recent assistant response
        last_lines=$(tail -20 "$transcript_path" 2>/dev/null)
        
        # Look for assistant response with our session ID
        temp_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                # Check if this is an assistant message with matching session
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                line_session=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.sessionId // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" && "$line_session" == "$session_id" ]]; then
                    # Try to extract text content
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 20 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
        
        if [[ -n "$temp_response" && ${#temp_response} -gt 20 ]]; then
            last_response="$temp_response"
            echo "Found complete response on attempt $((attempt + 1)): ${#last_response} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            break
        fi
        
        echo "Attempt $((attempt + 1)): Waiting for complete transcript entry..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        sleep 0.5
        ((attempt++))
    done
    
    if [[ -z "$last_response" ]]; then
        echo "Timeout: Falling back to any available response" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        # Fallback: try to get any recent assistant response
        last_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" ]]; then
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 10 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
    fi
    
    echo "Final extracted response length: ${#last_response}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    echo "First 150 chars: ${last_response:0:150}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    if [[ -n "$last_response" && ${#last_response} -gt 10 ]]; then
        # Clean up markdown
        clean_text=$(echo "$last_response" | \
            sed 's/\\n/ /g' | \
            sed 's/\*\*\([^*]*\)\*\*/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/`\([^`]*\)`/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/<[^>]*>//g')
        
        echo "Cleaned text length: ${#clean_text}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Calculate estimated speech time at 220 WPM
        # Average 5 characters per word, 220 WPM = 1100 characters per minute = 18.33 chars/second
        estimated_seconds=$(echo "${#clean_text} / 18.33" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
        echo "Estimated speech time: ${estimated_seconds} seconds for ${#clean_text} characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # If response is short enough (≤10 seconds), read the entire thing
        if (( $(echo "$estimated_seconds <= 10" | bc -l) )); then
            final_sentence="$clean_text"
            echo "Reading entire response (${estimated_seconds}s ≤ 10s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            # For longer responses, get the last paragraph
            echo "Response too long (${estimated_seconds}s > 10s), reading last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            
            # Get the LAST PARAGRAPH by splitting on double newlines and taking the final one
            last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n\\n/\n\n/g' | awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} END{print}' | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//' | sed 's/[[:space:]]*$//')
            
            # If the last paragraph is too short or empty, try splitting on single newlines
            if [[ -z "$last_paragraph" || ${#last_paragraph} -lt 20 ]]; then
                last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g' | awk 'END{print}' | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
            fi
            
            # If still too short, fall back to last 150 characters
            if [[ -z "$last_paragraph" || ${#last_paragraph} -lt 15 ]]; then
                last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
            fi
            
            final_sentence="$last_paragraph"
        fi
        
        echo "Final text for TTS (${#final_sentence} chars): ${final_sentence:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Speak the final sentence at a slower rate
        if [[ -n "$final_sentence" && ${#final_sentence} -gt 3 ]]; then
            # Use -r flag to set speech rate (words per minute)
            # User prefers 220 WPM for optimal speech
            nohup say -r 220 "$final_sentence" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "TTS executed successfully at 220 WPM" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "Fallback TTS executed - final sentence too short" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
    else
        # Fallback message
        nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
        echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    fi
else
    # Fallback if no transcript available
    nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
fi

content.text: Now I'll implement the core enhancement - the backward paragraph aggregation logic. This will replace the current simple "last paragraph" approach:

input.old_string:
else

            fi

input.new_string:
else
            # For longer responses, use intelligent paragraph aggregation
            echo "Response too long (${estimated_seconds}s > ${MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS}s), using paragraph aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            
            # Split text into paragraphs (try double newlines first, then single newlines)
            # Create temporary file for paragraph processing
            temp_file="/tmp/claude_paragraphs_$$"
            echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n\\n/\n\n/g' > "$temp_file"
            
            # Split on double newlines if they exist, otherwise single newlines
            if grep -q $'\n\n' "$temp_file"; then
                paragraph_array=($(awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 0) print NR":"$0}' "$temp_file"))
                echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs using double-newline separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Fall back to single newlines for paragraph separation
                echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g' > "$temp_file"
                paragraph_array=($(awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 10) print NR":"$0}' "$temp_file"))
                echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs using single-newline separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
            
            rm -f "$temp_file"
            
            if [[ ${#paragraph_array[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
                # Fallback if no paragraphs found
                final_sentence=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
                echo "No paragraphs found, using last 150 characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Start with the last paragraph and work backwards
                aggregated_text=""
                paragraph_count=0
                
                # Work backwards through paragraphs
                for (( i=${#paragraph_array[@]}-1; i>=0; i-- )); do
                    # Extract paragraph content (remove the number prefix)
                    current_paragraph="${paragraph_array[i]#*:}"
                    
                    # Try adding this paragraph to our aggregated text
                    if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph"
                    else
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph $aggregated_text"
                    fi
                    
                    potential_length=${#potential_text}
                    potential_seconds=$(echo "$potential_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l)
                    
                    echo "Considering paragraph $((i+1)): ${#current_paragraph} chars, total would be ${potential_length} chars (${potential_seconds}s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    
                    # If adding this paragraph would exceed our target max, stop (unless we have nothing yet)
                    if [[ -n "$aggregated_text" ]] && (( $(echo "$potential_length > $TARGET_MAX_CHARS" | bc -l) )); then
                        echo "Adding paragraph would exceed target max (${TARGET_MAX_CHARS} chars), stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                    
                    # Add this paragraph
                    aggregated_text="$potential_text"
                    ((paragraph_count++))
                    
                    # If we've reached our target minimum and have at least one substantial paragraph, we can stop
                    if (( potential_length >= TARGET_MIN_CHARS )) && (( ${#current_paragraph} >= MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS )); then
                        echo "Reached target minimum (${TARGET_MIN_CHARS} chars) with substantial content, stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                done
                
                # If we still don't have enough content, use what we have
                if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                    aggregated_text="${paragraph_array[-1]#*:}"  # Last paragraph
                    echo "Fallback: using last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                fi
                
                final_sentence="$aggregated_text"
                final_length=${#final_sentence}
                final_seconds=$(echo "$final_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
                echo "Final aggregation: $paragraph_count paragraph(s), ${final_length} chars, ${final_seconds}s" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
        fi

#!/bin/bash

# Enhanced TTS script - Intelligently speaks Claude responses with paragraph aggregation
# Configurable TTS parameters
SPEECH_RATE=220                    # Words per minute
CHARS_PER_SECOND=18.33            # Estimated characters per second (220 WPM / 60 * 5 chars/word)
MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS=10      # If entire response ≤ this, read it all
MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS=50            # Minimum characters for a paragraph to be considered adequate
TARGET_MIN_SECONDS=3              # Target minimum speech duration 
TARGET_MAX_SECONDS=8              # Target maximum speech duration before stopping aggregation
TARGET_MIN_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MIN_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
TARGET_MAX_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MAX_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
# Rotate log if it gets too large (>50KB)
if [[ -f /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log ]] && [[ $(stat -f%z /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log 2>/dev/null || echo 0) -gt 51200 ]]; then
    mv /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log.old
fi
echo "$(date): Enhanced TTS hook triggered" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Read JSON input from stdin
input=$(cat)
echo "Input received: $input" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Extract session_id and transcript_path from JSON input
session_id=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session_id // empty')
transcript_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.transcript_path // empty')
echo "Session ID: $session_id" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Transcript path: $transcript_path" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

if [[ -n "$transcript_path" && -f "$transcript_path" ]]; then
    echo "File exists and is readable" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    # Wait for transcript to be fully written by polling for a complete entry
    # We'll wait up to 5 seconds, checking every 0.5 seconds
    max_attempts=10
    attempt=0
    last_response=""
    
    while [[ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]]; do
        # Get the last few lines and look for the most recent assistant response
        last_lines=$(tail -20 "$transcript_path" 2>/dev/null)
        
        # Look for assistant response with our session ID
        temp_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                # Check if this is an assistant message with matching session
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                line_session=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.sessionId // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" && "$line_session" == "$session_id" ]]; then
                    # Try to extract text content
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 20 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
        
        if [[ -n "$temp_response" && ${#temp_response} -gt 20 ]]; then
            last_response="$temp_response"
            echo "Found complete response on attempt $((attempt + 1)): ${#last_response} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            break
        fi
        
        echo "Attempt $((attempt + 1)): Waiting for complete transcript entry..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        sleep 0.5
        ((attempt++))
    done
    
    if [[ -z "$last_response" ]]; then
        echo "Timeout: Falling back to any available response" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        # Fallback: try to get any recent assistant response
        last_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" ]]; then
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 10 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
    fi
    
    echo "Final extracted response length: ${#last_response}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    echo "First 150 chars: ${last_response:0:150}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    if [[ -n "$last_response" && ${#last_response} -gt 10 ]]; then
        # Clean up markdown
        clean_text=$(echo "$last_response" | \
            sed 's/\\n/ /g' | \
            sed 's/\*\*\([^*]*\)\*\*/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/`\([^`]*\)`/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/<[^>]*>//g')
        
        echo "Cleaned text length: ${#clean_text}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Calculate estimated speech time using configured parameters
        estimated_seconds=$(echo "${#clean_text} / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
        echo "Estimated speech time: ${estimated_seconds} seconds for ${#clean_text} characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # If response is short enough, read the entire thing
        if (( $(echo "$estimated_seconds <= $MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS" | bc -l) )); then
            final_sentence="$clean_text"
            echo "Reading entire response (${estimated_seconds}s ≤ 10s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            # For longer responses, get the last paragraph
            echo "Response too long (${estimated_seconds}s > 10s), reading last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            
            # Get the LAST PARAGRAPH by splitting on double newlines and taking the final one
            last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n\\n/\n\n/g' | awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} END{print}' | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//' | sed 's/[[:space:]]*$//')
            
            # If the last paragraph is too short or empty, try splitting on single newlines
            if [[ -z "$last_paragraph" || ${#last_paragraph} -lt 20 ]]; then
                last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g' | awk 'END{print}' | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
            fi
            
            # If still too short, fall back to last 150 characters
            if [[ -z "$last_paragraph" || ${#last_paragraph} -lt 15 ]]; then
                last_paragraph=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
            fi
            
            final_sentence="$last_paragraph"
        fi
        
        echo "Final text for TTS (${#final_sentence} chars): ${final_sentence:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Speak the final sentence at a slower rate
        if [[ -n "$final_sentence" && ${#final_sentence} -gt 3 ]]; then
            # Use -r flag to set speech rate (words per minute)
            # User prefers 220 WPM for optimal speech
            nohup say -r 220 "$final_sentence" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "TTS executed successfully at 220 WPM" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "Fallback TTS executed - final sentence too short" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
    else
        # Fallback message
        nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
        echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    fi
else
    # Fallback if no transcript available
    nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
fi

            # Split on double newlines if they exist, otherwise single newlines

                paragraph_array=($(awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 0) print NR":"$0}' "$temp_file"))
                echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs using double-newline separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Fall back to single newlines for paragraph separation
                echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g' > "$temp_file"
                paragraph_array=($(awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 10) print NR":"$0}' "$temp_file"))
                echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs using single-newline separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
            
            rm -f "$temp_file"
            
            if [[ ${#paragraph_array[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
                # Fallback if no paragraphs found
                final_sentence=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
                echo "No paragraphs found, using last 150 characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Start with the last paragraph and work backwards
                aggregated_text=""
                paragraph_count=0
                
                # Work backwards through paragraphs
                for (( i=${#paragraph_array[@]}-1; i>=0; i-- )); do
                    # Extract paragraph content (remove the number prefix)
                    current_paragraph="${paragraph_array[i]#*:}"
                    
                    # Try adding this paragraph to our aggregated text
                    if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph"
                    else
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph $aggregated_text"
                    fi
                    
                    potential_length=${#potential_text}
                    potential_seconds=$(echo "$potential_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l)
                    
                    echo "Considering paragraph $((i+1)): ${#current_paragraph} chars, total would be ${potential_length} chars (${potential_seconds}s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    
                    # If adding this paragraph would exceed our target max, stop (unless we have nothing yet)
                    if [[ -n "$aggregated_text" ]] && (( $(echo "$potential_length > $TARGET_MAX_CHARS" | bc -l) )); then
                        echo "Adding paragraph would exceed target max (${TARGET_MAX_CHARS} chars), stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                    
                    # Add this paragraph
                    aggregated_text="$potential_text"
                    ((paragraph_count++))
                    
                    # If we've reached our target minimum and have at least one substantial paragraph, we can stop
                    if (( potential_length >= TARGET_MIN_CHARS )) && (( ${#current_paragraph} >= MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS )); then
                        echo "Reached target minimum (${TARGET_MIN_CHARS} chars) with substantial content, stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                done
                
                # If we still don't have enough content, use what we have
                if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                    aggregated_text="${paragraph_array[-1]#*:}"  # Last paragraph
                    echo "Fallback: using last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                fi
                
                final_sentence="$aggregated_text"
                final_length=${#final_sentence}
                final_seconds=$(echo "$final_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
                echo "Final aggregation: $paragraph_count paragraph(s), ${final_length} chars, ${final_seconds}s" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
        fi
        
        echo "Final text for TTS (${#final_sentence} chars): ${final_sentence:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Speak the final sentence at a slower rate
        if [[ -n "$final_sentence" && ${#final_sentence} -gt 3 ]]; then
            # Use -r flag to set speech rate (words per minute)
            # User prefers 220 WPM for optimal speech
            nohup say -r 220 "$final_sentence" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "TTS executed successfully at 220 WPM" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "Fallback TTS executed - final sentence too short" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
    else
        # Fallback message
        nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
        echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    fi
else
    # Fallback if no transcript available
    nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
fi

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash

# Enhanced TTS script - Intelligently speaks Claude responses with paragraph aggregation
# Configurable TTS parameters
SPEECH_RATE=220                    # Words per minute
CHARS_PER_SECOND=18.33            # Estimated characters per second (220 WPM / 60 * 5 chars/word)
MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS=10      # If entire response ≤ this, read it all
MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS=50            # Minimum characters for a paragraph to be considered adequate
TARGET_MIN_SECONDS=3              # Target minimum speech duration 
TARGET_MAX_SECONDS=8              # Target maximum speech duration before stopping aggregation
TARGET_MIN_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MIN_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
TARGET_MAX_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MAX_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
# Rotate log if it gets too large (>50KB)
if [[ -f /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log ]] && [[ $(stat -f%z /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log 2>/dev/null || echo 0) -gt 51200 ]]; then
    mv /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log.old
fi
echo "$(date): Enhanced TTS hook triggered" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Read JSON input from stdin
input=$(cat)
echo "Input received: $input" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Extract session_id and transcript_path from JSON input
session_id=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session_id // empty')
transcript_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.transcript_path // empty')
echo "Session ID: $session_id" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Transcript path: $transcript_path" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

if [[ -n "$transcript_path" && -f "$transcript_path" ]]; then
    echo "File exists and is readable" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    # Wait for transcript to be fully written by polling for a complete entry
    # We'll wait up to 5 seconds, checking every 0.5 seconds
    max_attempts=10
    attempt=0
    last_response=""
    
    while [[ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]]; do
        # Get the last few lines and look for the most recent assistant response
        last_lines=$(tail -20 "$transcript_path" 2>/dev/null)
        
        # Look for assistant response with our session ID
        temp_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                # Check if this is an assistant message with matching session
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                line_session=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.sessionId // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" && "$line_session" == "$session_id" ]]; then
                    # Try to extract text content
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 20 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
        
        if [[ -n "$temp_response" && ${#temp_response} -gt 20 ]]; then
            last_response="$temp_response"
            echo "Found complete response on attempt $((attempt + 1)): ${#last_response} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            break
        fi
        
        echo "Attempt $((attempt + 1)): Waiting for complete transcript entry..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        sleep 0.5
        ((attempt++))
    done
    
    if [[ -z "$last_response" ]]; then
        echo "Timeout: Falling back to any available response" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        # Fallback: try to get any recent assistant response
        last_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" ]]; then
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 10 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
    fi
    
    echo "Final extracted response length: ${#last_response}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    echo "First 150 chars: ${last_response:0:150}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    if [[ -n "$last_response" && ${#last_response} -gt 10 ]]; then
        # Clean up markdown
        clean_text=$(echo "$last_response" | \
            sed 's/\\n/ /g' | \
            sed 's/\*\*\([^*]*\)\*\*/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/`\([^`]*\)`/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/<[^>]*>//g')
        
        echo "Cleaned text length: ${#clean_text}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Calculate estimated speech time using configured parameters
        estimated_seconds=$(echo "${#clean_text} / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
        echo "Estimated speech time: ${estimated_seconds} seconds for ${#clean_text} characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # If response is short enough, read the entire thing
        if (( $(echo "$estimated_seconds <= $MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS" | bc -l) )); then
            final_sentence="$clean_text"
            echo "Reading entire response (${estimated_seconds}s ≤ 10s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            # For longer responses, use intelligent paragraph aggregation
            echo "Response too long (${estimated_seconds}s > ${MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS}s), using paragraph aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            
            # Split text into paragraphs (try double newlines first, then single newlines)
            # Create temporary file for paragraph processing
            temp_file="/tmp/claude_paragraphs_$$"
            echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n\\n/\n\n/g' > "$temp_file"
            
            # Split on double newlines if they exist, otherwise single newlines
            if grep -q $'\n\n' "$temp_file"; then
                paragraph_array=($(awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 0) print NR":"$0}' "$temp_file"))
                echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs using double-newline separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Fall back to single newlines for paragraph separation
                echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g' > "$temp_file"
                paragraph_array=($(awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 10) print NR":"$0}' "$temp_file"))
                echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs using single-newline separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
            
            rm -f "$temp_file"
            
            if [[ ${#paragraph_array[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
                # Fallback if no paragraphs found
                final_sentence=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
                echo "No paragraphs found, using last 150 characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Start with the last paragraph and work backwards
                aggregated_text=""
                paragraph_count=0
                
                # Work backwards through paragraphs
                for (( i=${#paragraph_array[@]}-1; i>=0; i-- )); do
                    # Extract paragraph content (remove the number prefix)
                    current_paragraph="${paragraph_array[i]#*:}"
                    
                    # Try adding this paragraph to our aggregated text
                    if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph"
                    else
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph $aggregated_text"
                    fi
                    
                    potential_length=${#potential_text}
                    potential_seconds=$(echo "$potential_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l)
                    
                    echo "Considering paragraph $((i+1)): ${#current_paragraph} chars, total would be ${potential_length} chars (${potential_seconds}s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    
                    # If adding this paragraph would exceed our target max, stop (unless we have nothing yet)
                    if [[ -n "$aggregated_text" ]] && (( $(echo "$potential_length > $TARGET_MAX_CHARS" | bc -l) )); then
                        echo "Adding paragraph would exceed target max (${TARGET_MAX_CHARS} chars), stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                    
                    # Add this paragraph
                    aggregated_text="$potential_text"
                    ((paragraph_count++))
                    
                    # If we've reached our target minimum and have at least one substantial paragraph, we can stop
                    if (( potential_length >= TARGET_MIN_CHARS )) && (( ${#current_paragraph} >= MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS )); then
                        echo "Reached target minimum (${TARGET_MIN_CHARS} chars) with substantial content, stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                done
                
                # If we still don't have enough content, use what we have
                if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                    aggregated_text="${paragraph_array[-1]#*:}"  # Last paragraph
                    echo "Fallback: using last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                fi
                
                final_sentence="$aggregated_text"
                final_length=${#final_sentence}
                final_seconds=$(echo "$final_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
                echo "Final aggregation: $paragraph_count paragraph(s), ${final_length} chars, ${final_seconds}s" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
        fi
        
        echo "Final text for TTS (${#final_sentence} chars): ${final_sentence:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Speak the final sentence using configured speech rate
        if [[ -n "$final_sentence" && ${#final_sentence} -gt 3 ]]; then
            nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "$final_sentence" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "TTS executed successfully at ${SPEECH_RATE} WPM" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "Fallback TTS executed - final sentence too short" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
    else
        # Fallback message
        nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
        echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    fi
else
    # Fallback if no transcript available
    nohup say -r 220 "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
fi

echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

#!/bin/bash

# Enhanced TTS script - Intelligently speaks Claude responses with paragraph aggregation
# Configurable TTS parameters
SPEECH_RATE=220                    # Words per minute
CHARS_PER_SECOND=18.33            # Estimated characters per second (220 WPM / 60 * 5 chars/word)
MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS=10      # If entire response ≤ this, read it all
MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS=50            # Minimum characters for a paragraph to be considered adequate
TARGET_MIN_SECONDS=3              # Target minimum speech duration 
TARGET_MAX_SECONDS=8              # Target maximum speech duration before stopping aggregation
TARGET_MIN_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MIN_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
TARGET_MAX_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MAX_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
# Rotate log if it gets too large (>50KB)
if [[ -f /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log ]] && [[ $(stat -f%z /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log 2>/dev/null || echo 0) -gt 51200 ]]; then
    mv /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log.old
fi
echo "$(date): Enhanced TTS hook triggered" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Read JSON input from stdin
input=$(cat)
echo "Input received: $input" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Extract session_id and transcript_path from JSON input
session_id=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session_id // empty')
transcript_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.transcript_path // empty')
echo "Session ID: $session_id" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Transcript path: $transcript_path" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

if [[ -n "$transcript_path" && -f "$transcript_path" ]]; then
    echo "File exists and is readable" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    # Wait for transcript to be fully written by polling for a complete entry
    # We'll wait up to 5 seconds, checking every 0.5 seconds
    max_attempts=10
    attempt=0
    last_response=""
    
    while [[ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]]; do
        # Get the last few lines and look for the most recent assistant response
        last_lines=$(tail -20 "$transcript_path" 2>/dev/null)
        
        # Look for assistant response with our session ID
        temp_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                # Check if this is an assistant message with matching session
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                line_session=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.sessionId // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" && "$line_session" == "$session_id" ]]; then
                    # Try to extract text content
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 20 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
        
        if [[ -n "$temp_response" && ${#temp_response} -gt 20 ]]; then
            last_response="$temp_response"
            echo "Found complete response on attempt $((attempt + 1)): ${#last_response} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            break
        fi
        
        echo "Attempt $((attempt + 1)): Waiting for complete transcript entry..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        sleep 0.5
        ((attempt++))
    done
    
    if [[ -z "$last_response" ]]; then
        echo "Timeout: Falling back to any available response" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        # Fallback: try to get any recent assistant response
        last_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" ]]; then
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 10 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
    fi
    
    echo "Final extracted response length: ${#last_response}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    echo "First 150 chars: ${last_response:0:150}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    if [[ -n "$last_response" && ${#last_response} -gt 10 ]]; then
        # Clean up markdown
        clean_text=$(echo "$last_response" | \
            sed 's/\\n/ /g' | \
            sed 's/\*\*\([^*]*\)\*\*/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/`\([^`]*\)`/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/<[^>]*>//g')
        
        echo "Cleaned text length: ${#clean_text}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Calculate estimated speech time using configured parameters
        estimated_seconds=$(echo "${#clean_text} / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
        echo "Estimated speech time: ${estimated_seconds} seconds for ${#clean_text} characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # If response is short enough, read the entire thing
        if (( $(echo "$estimated_seconds <= $MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS" | bc -l) )); then
            final_sentence="$clean_text"
            echo "Reading entire response (${estimated_seconds}s ≤ 10s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            # For longer responses, use intelligent paragraph aggregation
            echo "Response too long (${estimated_seconds}s > ${MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS}s), using paragraph aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            
            # Split text into paragraphs (try double newlines first, then single newlines)
            # Create temporary file for paragraph processing
            temp_file="/tmp/claude_paragraphs_$$"
            echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n\\n/\n\n/g' > "$temp_file"
            
            # Split on double newlines if they exist, otherwise single newlines
            if grep -q $'\n\n' "$temp_file"; then
                paragraph_array=($(awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 0) print NR":"$0}' "$temp_file"))
                echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs using double-newline separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Fall back to single newlines for paragraph separation
                echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g' > "$temp_file"
                paragraph_array=($(awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 10) print NR":"$0}' "$temp_file"))
                echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs using single-newline separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
            
            rm -f "$temp_file"
            
            if [[ ${#paragraph_array[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
                # Fallback if no paragraphs found
                final_sentence=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
                echo "No paragraphs found, using last 150 characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Start with the last paragraph and work backwards
                aggregated_text=""
                paragraph_count=0
                
                # Work backwards through paragraphs
                for (( i=${#paragraph_array[@]}-1; i>=0; i-- )); do
                    # Extract paragraph content (remove the number prefix)
                    current_paragraph="${paragraph_array[i]#*:}"
                    
                    # Try adding this paragraph to our aggregated text
                    if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph"
                    else
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph $aggregated_text"
                    fi
                    
                    potential_length=${#potential_text}
                    potential_seconds=$(echo "$potential_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l)
                    
                    echo "Considering paragraph $((i+1)): ${#current_paragraph} chars, total would be ${potential_length} chars (${potential_seconds}s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    
                    # If adding this paragraph would exceed our target max, stop (unless we have nothing yet)
                    if [[ -n "$aggregated_text" ]] && (( $(echo "$potential_length > $TARGET_MAX_CHARS" | bc -l) )); then
                        echo "Adding paragraph would exceed target max (${TARGET_MAX_CHARS} chars), stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                    
                    # Add this paragraph
                    aggregated_text="$potential_text"
                    ((paragraph_count++))
                    
                    # If we've reached our target minimum and have at least one substantial paragraph, we can stop
                    if (( potential_length >= TARGET_MIN_CHARS )) && (( ${#current_paragraph} >= MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS )); then
                        echo "Reached target minimum (${TARGET_MIN_CHARS} chars) with substantial content, stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                done
                
                # If we still don't have enough content, use what we have
                if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                    aggregated_text="${paragraph_array[-1]#*:}"  # Last paragraph
                    echo "Fallback: using last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                fi
                
                final_sentence="$aggregated_text"
                final_length=${#final_sentence}
                final_seconds=$(echo "$final_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
                echo "Final aggregation: $paragraph_count paragraph(s), ${final_length} chars, ${final_seconds}s" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
        fi
        
        echo "Final text for TTS (${#final_sentence} chars): ${final_sentence:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Speak the final sentence using configured speech rate
        if [[ -n "$final_sentence" && ${#final_sentence} -gt 3 ]]; then
            nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "$final_sentence" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "TTS executed successfully at ${SPEECH_RATE} WPM" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "Fallback TTS executed - final sentence too short" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
    else
        # Fallback message
        nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
        echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    fi
else
    # Fallback if no transcript available
    nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
fi

            temp_file="/tmp/claude_paragraphs_$$"
            echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n\\n/\n\n/g' > "$temp_file"
            
            # Split on double newlines if they exist, otherwise single newlines
            if grep -q $'\n\n' "$temp_file"; then
                # Use double newlines for paragraph separation
                readarray -t paragraph_array < <(awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 5) print $0}' "$temp_file")
                echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs using double-newline separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Fall back to single newlines, but filter for substantial content
                echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g' > "$temp_file"
                readarray -t paragraph_array < <(awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 15) print $0}' "$temp_file")
                echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs using single-newline separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
            
            rm -f "$temp_file"
            
            if [[ ${#paragraph_array[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
                # Fallback if no paragraphs found
                final_sentence=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
                echo "No paragraphs found, using last 150 characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Start with the last paragraph and work backwards
                aggregated_text=""
                paragraph_count=0
                
                # Work backwards through paragraphs
                for (( i=${#paragraph_array[@]}-1; i>=0; i-- )); do
                    # Extract paragraph content (remove the number prefix)
                    current_paragraph="${paragraph_array[i]#*:}"
                    
                    # Try adding this paragraph to our aggregated text
                    if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph"
                    else
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph $aggregated_text"
                    fi
                    
                    potential_length=${#potential_text}
                    potential_seconds=$(echo "$potential_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l)
                    
                    echo "Considering paragraph $((i+1)): ${#current_paragraph} chars, total would be ${potential_length} chars (${potential_seconds}s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    
                    # If adding this paragraph would exceed our target max, stop (unless we have nothing yet)
                    if [[ -n "$aggregated_text" ]] && (( $(echo "$potential_length > $TARGET_MAX_CHARS" | bc -l) )); then
                        echo "Adding paragraph would exceed target max (${TARGET_MAX_CHARS} chars), stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                    
                    # Add this paragraph
                    aggregated_text="$potential_text"
                    ((paragraph_count++))
                    
                    # If we've reached our target minimum and have at least one substantial paragraph, we can stop
                    if (( potential_length >= TARGET_MIN_CHARS )) && (( ${#current_paragraph} >= MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS )); then
                        echo "Reached target minimum (${TARGET_MIN_CHARS} chars) with substantial content, stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                done
                
                # If we still don't have enough content, use what we have
                if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                    aggregated_text="${paragraph_array[-1]#*:}"  # Last paragraph
                    echo "Fallback: using last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                fi
                
                final_sentence="$aggregated_text"
                final_length=${#final_sentence}
                final_seconds=$(echo "$final_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
                echo "Final aggregation: $paragraph_count paragraph(s), ${final_length} chars, ${final_seconds}s" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
        fi
        
        echo "Final text for TTS (${#final_sentence} chars): ${final_sentence:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Speak the final sentence using configured speech rate
        if [[ -n "$final_sentence" && ${#final_sentence} -gt 3 ]]; then
            nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "$final_sentence" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "TTS executed successfully at ${SPEECH_RATE} WPM" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "Fallback TTS executed - final sentence too short" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
    else
        # Fallback message
        nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
        echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    fi
else
    # Fallback if no transcript available
    nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
fi
